results.summary: Analysis and optimization of ThePetsTable registration page to improve customer experience and conversion rates. Despite low drop-off rates (11.62% to 12.25%), the project explores UI improvements to move from transactional to emotional tone and considers adding social login options. The registration page will be retained as it serves critical functions for user verification and reactivation.

must_have: Keep the registration page (not remove it)
Improve sign up CTA to increase customer intent
Monitor 2-week conversions post WKND cookie improvements
Maintain email autopopulation from WKND cookie
Verify whether prospect already has an account
nice_to_have: Use social logins (Apple, Google, Facebook) - P2 priority
Move from transactional to emotional tone in UI
Optimize page UI for better customer experience
out_of_scope: Immediate decision on Add-ons promotional banner removal

decisions.what: Keep the registration page
decisions.rationale: Registration page is necessary to verify existing accounts, redirect to reactivation page, prevent redundant navigation, and adjust applicable discounts. Drop-off rates are already low (11.62% to 12.25%)

decisions.what: Keep Add-ons promotional banner
decisions.rationale: Previous experiments with seasonal promotional banners showed positive CVR improvements. Customers learn about Add-ons for first time on sign up page. Limited experimental bandwidth available.

decisions.what: Make minimal functional changes to registration page
decisions.rationale: Page already has low friction due to email autopopulation and high customer intent from completing 9-step quiz

technical: Site cookies for logged-in session redirect
Social login integration (Apple, Google, Facebook) - if implemented

success_metrics: Conversion rate (CVR) from registration to address page
Session percentage reaching Address page vs Registration page
Registration completion rate
2-week conversions post WKND cookie improvements
Password submission rate (currently 96.6% based on HelloFresh data)
Overall checkout completion rate

entities.name: ThePetsTable
entities.role: Primary product being analyzed - pet food subscription service

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.role: Comparison benchmark - shows 45%+ drop-off from registration to address page

entities.role: Comparison benchmark mentioned for session percentages

entities.name: WKND cookie
entities.role: Technical system enabling email autopopulation on registration page

entities.role: Experimentation platform used by HelloFresh for social login testing

entities.name: Google Analytics
entities.role: Analytics platform showing 30% abandonment rate data

results.summary: This project aims to unify cancellation funnels across all HelloFresh Group brands by replicating the proven HelloFresh cancellation flow UX to other brands including meal-kit, RTE, The PetsTable, GoodChop, and Factor. The initiative will standardize the cancellation experience, improve customer retention, and streamline operational and technical maintenance through unified deflection strategies and cancellation surveys.

must_have: Replicate HelloFresh cancellation flow UX to all remaining brands (meal-kit, RTE, The PetsTable, GoodChop, Factor Form)
Create new cancellation funnel module with cross-brand functionality
Handle all existing funnel variations (BAU flow, one-step funnel, one-click funnel, French adjusted funnel) in scalable way
Implement HelloFresh cancellation survey framework for other brands
Unify deflection strategies across brands including: benefits display, offer new discount, change plan frequency, change plan size, skip instead of cancel
Maintain brand-specific routing (different links for HF vs Factor subscription settings)
Ensure market-level legal compliance for cancellation regulations
Preserve local non-legal decisions taken at market level
nice_to_have: A/B test for all brands excluding HelloFresh (control = BAU, variation = unified funnel)
Alternative: A/B test targeting Factor US customers only
out_of_scope: Switch to other brand deflection (removed from initiative scope, keep live for HelloFresh only)
Enabling non-technical stakeholders to modify survey & deflections directly

decisions.what: Rollout scenario selection (A/B test vs pre-post analysis)
decisions.rationale: Decision depends on engineering complexity and effort estimation

decisions.what: Remove 'Switch to other brand' deflection from unified funnel
decisions.rationale: Scope reduction, maintain only for HelloFresh brand

decisions.what: Change 'Change plan size' to direct link to subscription settings
decisions.rationale: No price information shown and has one of lowest deflection rates

decisions.what: Convert 'Offer new discount' from special deflection to regular module
decisions.rationale: Requires small design change for consistency

decisions.what: Technical team owns final decision on local setups
decisions.rationale: Balance capacity constraints with local input requirements

technical: Migration of HelloFresh flow pieces to cross-brand funnel
Orchestration layer for RTE subscription cancellation when meal kit subscription is cancelled
Google Analytics events alignment across brands
Tableau as source of truth for metrics
team: Voice of Customer team (primary users of cancellation survey results)
Local market teams (compliance and local requirements input)

success_metrics: Customer retention improvement for Factor and other brands
Standardized cancellation experience across brands
Consistent customer feedback collection on cancellation reasons
Deflection rate performance across brands
Operational and technical maintenance efficiency

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.role: Source brand with proven cancellation funnel

entities.name: Chattermill
entities.role: Receives survey comments from Voice of Customer team

entities.name: Tableau
entities.role: Source of truth for cancellation metrics

results.target_date: Week 2-3 of Q1 2026 (delayed from pre-holiday launch)
results.summary: A time-boxed CVR (conversion rate) improvement initiative focusing on discovery and funnel optimization, including banner placements and communication reinforcements. Multiple sub-initiatives are in progress including charger checkout, reactivation page, PDPs, and portion percentages, with several blocked by technical issues and contractor delays.

must_have: CVR program focused on customer experience from landing page onwards
Charger checkout with refund functionality
Reactivation page for multi-subscription users
PDPs (Product Detail Pages) implementation
Different portion percentages functionality
Multi-subscription support in new pricing endpoint
Voucher application for multi-subscription users
nice_to_have: Quick actions improvements using React Native
App work including web view and React Native specifications
out_of_scope: Recurring CVR analysis and reporting (owned by Doas and team)
Cut scope from contractor deliverables (to be reviewed and potentially re-scoped)

decisions.what: Maria Chelminska to own CVR program
decisions.rationale: Need for substantial topic ownership; app work less demanding than anticipated as it focuses on technical specifications

decisions.what: Temporarily revert reactivation page to old pricing endpoint
decisions.rationale: New pricing endpoint incorrectly flags vouchers as fraudulent for multi-subscription users; need to secure value before holidays despite creating future overhead

decisions.what: Establish rule that multi-subscriptions must always be supported in new service development
decisions.rationale: Prevent recurring issues with multi-subscription users in shopping platform space

decisions.what: Use scope-based pricing model with contractors rather than time and materials
decisions.rationale: Beneficial despite expanded timeline and contractor underestimation of complexity

decisions.what: Leverage new team member Maria (starting January) for remaining initiatives and overhead work
decisions.rationale: Team impacted by delays; need additional resources to deliver Q1 work

external: Contractors (PDP and portion percentage work - described as 'sloppy' in following requirements)

success_metrics: CVR (Conversion Rate) improvement across funnel
Value secured from reactivations before holidays
Successful launch of charger checkout with refunds
Reactivation page deployment for multi-subscription users
Completion of PDP and portion percentage initiatives
Adherence to Q1 delivery timeline

results.doc_title: InComm / HelloFresh Tech Integration  - 2025/12/08 09:27 EST - Notes by Gemini
results.project_name: InComm / HelloFresh Tech Integration - Retail Gift Card Program
results.target_date: Not specified - Legal review delayed until January 2026 due to December 1st deadline miss
results.summary: HelloFresh is integrating with InComm to launch a new North American retail gift card program using transferred value activation. The integration involves physical gift cards activated at retail via IAB barcode scanning, with PIN-based redemption through HelloFresh's systems connecting to InComm's APIs for validation and value transfer.

must_have: Transferred value activation process via IAB barcode scanning at retail
PIN-based validation and redemption system
Custom-prefixed PIN generation capability
Error handling with specific timeout thresholds for 'get status' and 'redeem' requests
Retry/cancel recommendations for failed transactions
Reporting data including merchant name and location for analytics
Value management system for tracking card balances
Variable load product capability
Separate or combined Canadian and US contracts
nice_to_have: Single North American agreement to simplify legal review
Similar launch timelines for US and Canada markets
out_of_scope: HelloFresh involvement in initial card activation at retail

decisions.what: Preference for variable load product
decisions.rationale: Provides flexibility for different purchase amounts

decisions.what: Request for single North American agreement instead of separate contracts
decisions.rationale: Simplify legal review process and avoid creating unnecessary work for procurement team; enable similar launch timelines for US and Canada

decisions.what: Hold contract sending until North American agreement decision is made
decisions.rationale: No point sending Canadian-only contract if combined agreement is possible

technical: InComm 'get status' API for transaction verification
InComm reporting system for merchant analytics data
team: HelloFresh legal team (review delayed until January)
external: Retail partners (for card activation at point of sale)
Costco (specific program mentioned requiring economics finalization)

success_metrics: Merchant name and location data availability for analytics
Transaction success rates with proper error handling
Timeout threshold compliance for API requests
Contract finalization and legal approval timeline

results.doc_title: PRD: (ðŸ¥‡MVP) Cross-Selling as Market Integration; Recurring Multi-Subscription (v1.0)
results.project_name: Cross-Selling as Market Integration; Recurring Multi-Subscription (MVP)
results.summary: An MVP initiative to enable HelloFresh US customers to purchase Factor-produced Ready-to-Eat (RTE) meals through a multi-subscription model integrated into the HelloFresh experience. This 'Market Integration' strategy aims to serve more household meal moments, increase Average Order Rate (AOR), and reduce Customer Acquisition Costs (CACs) by offering both meal-kit and RTE options as part of the Top-5 Company Strategy #5 for 2025.

must_have: Multi-subscription technology enabling customers to have up to two separate subscriptions
Opt-in model via secondary recurring RTE subscription
Factor-produced RTE meals as physical product offering
Integration with HelloFresh US Core Menu
Order summary/receipt functionality for non-skipped meals
Pre-selection as fixed step for opt-in MVP
Menu availability checking mechanism
out_of_scope: Refactoring experience onto new Actives Journey revamp in React Native (Future 2026+ roadmap)
Manual management across Factor and cross-sell by Factor menu operations team

decisions.what: Use multi-subscription technology for opt-in and opt-out models
decisions.rationale: Enables lower commitment model with future default skipped capability

decisions.what: Use Factor-produced RTE meals instead of third-party vendor
decisions.rationale: Part of Market Integration strategy to gather insights for 2026 peak recommendations

decisions.what: Show order summary/receipt only for non-skipped meals
decisions.rationale: Consistent with HelloFresh practice of not showing cart/order summary for skipped subscriptions
decisions.approved_by: Under review by Katerina Scoullos, Arbaaz Dossani

decisions.what: Exclude add-ons from MVP scope
decisions.rationale: Scope reduction to simplify MVP delivery

decisions.what: Pre-selection as fixed step for opt-in MVP
decisions.rationale: Simplifies preference handling and reduces complexity on culinary tool and front-end sides

technical: Factor meal production and supply chain
external: Third-party vendor (previous Ready Made Meals supplier)

success_metrics: Average Order Rate (AOR) increase
Customer Acquisition Costs (CACs) reduction
Multi-subscription adoption rate
Cross-selling conversion rate
Household meal moments served

results.doc_title: Request- tech support for DACH juices launch
results.project_name: DACH Juices Launch - Pfand (Deposit) Tech Support
results.summary: HelloFresh and Factor need technical platform support to launch beverages (shots, juices, protein shakes, electrolyte drinks) in DACH and Nordic markets. The launch is blocked by legal requirements to display bottle deposit (Pfand) charges as separate line items in the checkout flow and invoices. This integration is required to comply with local regulatory requirements for beverages over 100ml.

must_have: Display Pfand/deposit amount as a separate line item in the 'Add-ons' section of checkout
Display Pfand/deposit amount as a separate line item in the 'Order Overview' section of checkout
Show exact number of units charged (e.g., '3x Pfand: â‚¬0.75')
Display individual deposit costs clearly showing quantity multiplied by unit price
Support market-specific deposit amounts that vary by country
Support different deposit prices based on bottle size (recipe-dependent)
Translate 'Pfand'/'Deposit' terminology for each market
Allow aggregated single line item for total deposits when multiple juice/shot packs are ordered
Display deposit charges in invoices (ideally)

decisions.what: Deposit amount varies by market and bottle size
decisions.rationale: Different markets have different regulatory requirements and bottle sizes may have different deposit amounts

decisions.what: Pfand must be displayed as separate line items in both Add-on and Order-summary sections
decisions.rationale: Legal requirement for compliance with DACH and Nordic regulations

decisions.what: Multiple juice/shot packs can show single collated line item for total deposit
decisions.rationale: Simplifies display while maintaining legal compliance, as long as exact units are shown

technical: Pricing engine to support market-specific and recipe-dependent deposit amounts
external: Local regulatory agencies in DACH (Germany, Austria, Switzerland)
Local regulatory agencies in Nordics (Denmark, Sweden, Norway)

success_metrics: Successful launch of beverages in DACH markets as paid and FFL add-ons
Legal compliance with Pfand display requirements
Net AOV increase from beverage portfolio
Incremental value in Free for Life and Loyalty Programs
Future enablement for Nordics and Ireland launches

entities.name: Factor
entities.role: Brand launching protein shakes and electrolyte drinks

entities.name: Nordics
entities.role: Future target market region (Denmark, Sweden, Norway)

entities.name: Free for Life Program
entities.role: Loyalty program to be enhanced by beverage portfolio

entities.name: Loyalty Programs
entities.role: Customer retention system to benefit from beverage launch

results.doc_title: Request- tech support for DACH juices launch
results.project_name: DACH Juices Launch - Pfand (Deposit) Tech Support
results.summary: HelloFresh and Factor need technical platform support to launch private label shots, juices, protein shakes, and electrolyte drinks in DACH and Nordic markets. The launch is blocked due to legal requirements to display bottle deposit (Pfand) charges as separate line items in the checkout flow and invoices. This requires UI and backend integration changes to clearly show deposit amounts per unit in both the add-ons section and order summary.

must_have: Display Pfand (deposit) amount as a separate line item in the Order Overview section of checkout funnel
Show Pfand amount in the Add-ons section as a separate line item
Display the number of units charged (e.g., '3x Pfand') alongside the monetary value
Support market-specific deposit amounts that vary by country
Support different deposit prices based on bottle size (recipe-dependent)
Translate 'Pfand/Deposit' terminology for each market
Allow aggregated single line item for total Pfand when multiple products are ordered, showing exact units
Display Pfand charges ideally in the invoice as well

decisions.what: Deposit amount varies by market and bottle size
decisions.rationale: Different markets have different legal requirements and bottle sizes may have different deposit prices

decisions.what: Pfand must be shown as separate line items in both Add-on and Order-summary sections
decisions.rationale: Legal requirement for DACH and Nordic markets

decisions.what: Multiple juice/shot packs can show single collated line item for total Deposit charge
decisions.rationale: Simplifies display while maintaining legal compliance, as long as exact units are shown

external: Local bottle deposit scheme providers (setup completed)

success_metrics: Launch of beverages >100ml in DACH as paid and FFL add-ons
Compliance with legal Pfand display requirements
Net AOV increase from beverage portfolio
Incremental value in Free for Life and Loyalty Programs
Successful launch enablement in Nordics (DK, SE, NO) and IE
